Little_Rock.Mills University Studies High School: Mills University Studies High School is a secondary school in Sweet Home, Arkansas (with a Little Rock postal address), serving students in grades 9 through 12 and is one of six high schools within the Pulaski County Special School District. The school opened on August 25th, 1969 and is named after the late Congressman Wilbur Daigh Mills. While drawing students from around its home area (e.g., College Station & Sweet Home), Mills also contains a hybrid Gifted & Talented magnet school focusing on college preparation through Advanced Placement courses.
